intro: Pogonatherum santapaui, commonly known as the Santa Paula grass, is a perennial grass native to California. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has fibrous roots and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of ecological study.
